summary: Waldringfield is a village and civil parish in Suffolk Coastal, Suffolk, England.
full_text:
Waldringfield is a village and civil parish in the Suffolk Coastal district, in the county of Suffolk, England. It is situated on the bank of the River Deben within the Suffolk Coast and Heaths Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, 4 miles  south of the town of Woodbridge and 8 miles  east of the county town of Ipswich.
All Saints church dates from the 14th century. Restored in the 19th century, it is a grade II* listed building.
Waldringfield Heath, between the village and Martlesham on the edge of Ipswich, is the site of Waldringfield Golf Club.
It also has a Yacht Club called Waldringfield Yacht Club.
^ "Civil Parish Population 2011". Retrieved 15 September 2015. 
^ "Name: CHURCH OF ALL SAINTS List entry Number: 1198720". English Heritage. Retrieved 3 April 2014. 
^ "Waldringfield Parish Plan" . Waldringfield Parish Council. Retrieved 2010-04-04.
title: Waldringfield
